arm_group.description: Veterans do not receiving pharmaceutical care

brief_summary.textblock:
This study investigates the effect of pharmaceutical care on a Veteran nursing home. 100
      patients will be selected into this controlled study.The hypothesis are:

        1. After patients receive pharmaceutical care, their drug related problems will be
           decreased.

        2. After patients received pharmaceutical care, their self-reported medical expenditure
           will be decreased.

clinical_study.brief_title: Pharmaceutical Care in VA Nursing Home
clinical_study.condition: Focus on the Elderly in a Nursing Home

detailed_description.textblock:
Around 200 residents in a Veteran nursing home will be selected for reviewing inclusion and
      exclusion criteria. A total of 100 subjected are selected into this randomized controlled
      trial. Each group will have 50 subjects and then divides into 4 subgroup, according to their
      drug items used (5-7 and over 8 items used).

      The inclusion criteria:

        1. Residents of the Veteran nursing home.

        2. over 65 years old.

        3. complete comprehensive geriatric assessment (CGA)

        4. prescription drugs more than 4 times/day, excluding stat order.

        5. with 2 or more chronic diseases.

      Exclusion criteria:

      1. residents who were in the pharmaceutical care project of Taiwan Pharmacists Association.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Residents in the Veteran nursing home

          -  Age over 65 years old

          -  Complete Comprehensive Geriatric Assessment (CGA)

          -  Use more than 4 drug item per day (excluding stat order)

          -  subjects with more than 2 chronic diseases.

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  subjects who were in pharmaceutical care project of Taiwan Pharmacist Association.

study_pop.textblock:
Resident from a Veteran nursing home and willing to receive the pharmaceutical care by
        pharmacists.

intervention.description: pharmacists provide pharmaceutical care to the intervention group, comparing to ordinary care in control group

clinical_study.official_title: The Impacts of Pharmaceutical Cares on the Elderly in a VA Nursing Home.

other_outcome.description: use health outcome measure, EQ-5D, to assess the quality of life issue.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: the controlled group is expected to have less drug items used.
subjects self-reported outpatients visit, hospitalization, drug, and healthy supplemental used.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case Control, Time Perspective: Prospective
